chief_complaint: Fever and shock for approximately one week
history_of_present_illness: A 24-year-old woman presents to a small hospital in rural Uganda with a 5-day history of fever. The illness started with a sore throat, achiness all over, and abdominal pain. She developed bilateral conjunctivitis and became increasingly unwell over the course of the past days.
exposure_and_epidemiology: {'residence_travel': 'Uganda', 'vectors': None, 'animals': None, 'water_food_risks': None, 'contacts': None, 'season_outbreak_context': None, 'occupation': None}
differential_diagnosis: [{'name': 'Marburg virus disease (MVD)', 'evidence': "Patient's husband died of a similar severe febrile illness, and Marburg virus has been associated with mines."}, {'name': 'Ebola virus disease (EVD)', 'evidence': "Patient's husband died of a similar severe febrile illness, and EVD has been detected in Uganda. Symptoms are non-specific but can include fever, conjunctivitis, and abdominal symptoms."}]
management_and_clinical_course: Treatment: ["IV artesunate", "IV lumefantrine", "IV ceftriaxone"] Response: Patient remained very unwell for several days but started to improve. Outcome: Patient recovered and was discharged after an additional 2 days in isolation.
final_diagnosis: {'name': 'Marburg virus disease', 'evidence': "Positive Marburg virus PCR result, patient's husband died of a similar illness, and Marburg virus has been associated with mines.", 'confirmation_method': 'PCR'}
